newsitem.title: HONG KONG: South Sea unaware of why share price up.
newsitem.headline: South Sea unaware of why share price up.

text.p: South Sea Development Co Ltd said on Friday it is not aware of any reasons for the recent increase in the price and trading volume of its shares.

The company was still in negotiation to sell a total of 93 percent of the issued share capital of Acesite (Phils) Hotel Corp but no binding agreement had been reached, the company said in a statement.
Shares of the company closed 16 cents or 58 percent higher at HK$0.435 on Thursday.
"The directors were not aware of any reasons for such increase," it said.

"Save as what we have disclosed on July 25 the directors confirm that there are no negotiations or agreements relating to intended acquisitions or realisations which are disclosable," the company said.

South Sea, a textile manufacturer and investment holding firm, announced in July 25 that it was in talk to sell its interest in Acesite, of which the company is for the time being the beneficial owner of 78 percent of the issued capital.
Acesite, a subsidiary of South Sea, owns and operates the Holiday Inn Manila Pavilion Hotel in the Philippines.
